2025-08-01.history: Bishop and Doctor of the Church, founder of the Redemptorists.

2025-08-02.saint: St. Eusebius of Vercelli; St. Peter Julian Eymard
2025-08-02.history: Eusebius was a bishop and defender of the faith; Eymard founded the Blessed Sacrament Congregation.

2025-08-03.history: The Church continues reflecting on the ministry of Christ.

2025-08-04.history: Patron saint of parish priests, known as the Curé of Ars.

2025-08-05.saint: Dedication of the Basilica of St. Mary Major
2025-08-05.history: First major church in the West dedicated to Our Lady.

2025-08-06.history: Jesus revealed His divine glory on Mount Tabor before Peter, James, and John.

2025-08-07.saint: St. Sixtus II and Companions, Martyrs; St. Cajetan
2025-08-07.history: Sixtus was pope martyred with companions; Cajetan founded the Theatines.

2025-08-08.history: Founder of the Order of Preachers (Dominicans).

2025-08-09.saint: St. Teresa Benedicta of the Cross (Edith Stein)
2025-08-09.history: Carmelite nun, philosopher, and martyr at Auschwitz.

2025-08-10.history: Deacon and martyr of Rome, remembered for his charity.

2025-08-11.history: Follower of St. Francis, founder of the Poor Clares.

2025-08-12.history: Founder of the Visitation Order with St. Francis de Sales.

2025-08-13.history: Pope Pontian and priest Hippolytus reconciled before their martyrdom.

2025-08-14.history: Franciscan priest who gave his life for another prisoner in Auschwitz.

2025-08-15.saint: Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-15.history: Mary was assumed body and soul into heavenly glory.

2025-08-16.history: First Christian king of Hungary, devoted to Mary and evangelization.

2025-08-17.history: The Gospel highlights faith and perseverance in following Christ.

2025-08-18.history: Ordinary weekday, inviting quiet growth in holiness.

2025-08-19.history: Priest and promoter of devotion to the Sacred and Immaculate Hearts.

2025-08-20.history: Cistercian abbot, preacher, and Doctor of the Church.

2025-08-21.history: Pope remembered for liturgical renewal and frequent Communion.

2025-08-22.saint: Queenship of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-22.history: Celebration of Mary as Queen of Heaven and Earth.

2025-08-23.history: First canonized saint of the Americas, a Dominican tertiary.

2025-08-24.history: One of the Twelve Apostles, traditionally martyred for his faith.

2025-08-25.history: King Louis IX of France and educator Joseph Calasanz, founder of the Piarists.

2025-08-26.history: Ordinary weekday, opportunity for daily faithfulness.

2025-08-27.history: Mother of St. Augustine, exemplar of persevering prayer.

2025-08-28.history: Bishop, theologian, and Doctor of the Church.

2025-08-29.saint: Passion of St. John the Baptist
2025-08-29.history: Beheaded for his witness to truth and fidelity to God.

2025-08-30.history: Ordinary weekday, growing quietly in discipleship.

2025-08-31.history: Jesus teaches humility and self-giving love.

2025-09-01.history: Ordinary weekday — a day for steady perseverance.

2025-09-02.history: Sanctify your work and your rest in Christ.

2025-09-03.history: Pope and Doctor of the Church; shepherd and reformer.

2025-09-04.history: Christ meets us in the ordinary rhythm of life.

2025-09-05.history: Founder of the Missionaries of Charity; servant of the poorest of the poor.

2025-09-06.saint: Saturday of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-09-06.history: A Saturday devotion honoring Our Lady.

2025-09-07.history: Called to reconciliation, mercy, and mutual correction in love.

2025-09-08.saint: Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-09-08.history: Celebrates the birth of Mary, mother of Jesus.

2025-09-09.history: Jesuit missionary to enslaved Africans; apostle of mercy.

2025-09-10.history: Invite Christ into small tasks and hidden sacrifices.

2025-09-11.history: Walk with the Lord in patience and hope.

2025-09-12.history: The name of Mary is a sign of hope and protection.

2025-09-13.history: Bishop and Doctor of the Church, famed for eloquence ('golden-mouth').

2025-09-14.history: We glory in the Cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.

2025-09-15.history: Mary shares in the Passion of her Son with steadfast faith.

2025-09-16.saint: Sts. Cornelius, Pope, and Cyprian, Bishop, Martyrs
2025-09-16.history: Shepherds who witnessed to unity and charity unto death.

2025-09-17.history: Jesuit cardinal and Doctor; defender of the faith.

2025-09-19.history: Bishop of Benevento; venerated for bold witness.

2025-09-20.saint: Sts. Andrew Kim Tae-gŏn, Paul Chŏng Ha-sang, and Companions, Martyrs
2025-09-20.history: Korean martyrs who gave their lives for Christ.

2025-09-21.history: Sunday outranks the Feast of St. Matthew this year in the General Roman Calendar.

2025-09-22.history: Bring the Gospel into your routine.

2025-09-24.history: Live charity in small hidden ways.

2025-09-25.history: Stay faithful in prayer and service.

2025-09-26.history: Physician brothers who served the poor and witnessed unto death.

2025-09-27.history: Priest dedicated to the poor; founder of the Vincentians.

2025-09-28.history: The call to conversion is urgent and joyful.

2025-09-29.saint: Sts. Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael, Archangels

2025-09-30.history: Priest and Doctor; translator of Scripture (Vulgate).
